entry.title: EYOC: Relay wins for Finland, Hungary, Czechia and Sweden
entry.summary: Monday’s relays were the last race at the 2024 European Youth Orienteering Championships in Szczechin, Poland. The more than 400 athletes were back in the forest after yesterday’s sprint and were met by a varied terrain with quite a number of hills and richly-forked courses. Here, Finland’s W16 team with Lotta Laakso, Anni Jantunen and […]

entry.title: IOF continues the course towards less climate emissions
entry.summary: The International Orienteering Federation is still well on its way to achieving its goals for lowering climate emissions. This appears from IOF’s Carbon Budget Report for 2023, which estimates the CO2 emissions of the federation in the past year and has just been released. The report has been created by IOF’s Environment and Sustainability Commission […]

entry.title: EYOC: Long distance in tough, Polish hills
entry.summary: Four different nations claimed the gold medals on the first day of European Youth Orienteering Championships, which take place in Szczechin, Poland this weekend. Saturday’s long distance tested the athletes’ physical abilities in the hilly terrain, where they also had to show their skills in coping with route planning on at least one long leg. […]

entry.title: Szczechin ready to host EYOC this weekend
entry.summary: More than 400 of the most talented young orienteers in Europe meet in Szczechin, Poland this weekend for the 2024 European Youth Orienteering Championships. The athletes compete in four classes W16, M16, W18 and M18 and three disciplines await: Long, Sprint and Relay. The forest terrain in northwestern Poland is rather hilly with eg. 280 […]

entry.title: Event Advisers’ Clinic in Canada from August 12-13
entry.summary: IOF’s FootO Commission organise an Event Advisers’ Clinic in Ottawa, Canada from August 12-13, 2024. The Clinic is organised for the education and recruitment of new IOF licensed Foot Orienteering Event Advisers. National orienteering federations are asked to identify and enter suitable candidates. Deadline for entries is June 30th. Go to the full invitation here.

entry.title: Whangarei Orienteering Club | History & welcome to ONZ
entry.summary: Exciting news! Whangarei Orienteering club have officially joined Orienteering New Zealand as a stand alone club. Up until now they have been a subsidiary club with North West Orienteering Club. The process of becoming a stand alone club has taken some time and effort, and so has compiling of the club history up until now. entry.title: Southland School Champs
entry.summary: Southland Orienteering Club’s annual Schools’ Championships attracted over 100 teams from all over Southland as well as Queenstown and Dunedin. There were 6 courses at Fosbender Park, in sand dune and coastal pine forest. The event gave competitors a chance to experience orienteering for the first time and for others to challenge their skills on more difficult courses. […] Southland School Champs first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: NZ Secondary Schools | 19 -21 July
entry.summary: Orienteering Wellington is looking forward to welcoming all year 7-13 orienteers from across New Zealand to the Wellington region for three days of high-quality orienteering from the 19th-21st July 2024. Join us and showcase your navigational skills, support your friends and create lasting memories in unique terrain. The events are located north of Wellington, towards the Kapiti Coast. entry.title: AIMS Games Entries close on Wed 5 June
entry.summary: There is only ONE WEEK left for you to register for the 2024 Zespri AIMS Games! Registrations close 7:59pm on 5th June 2024. Remember that School Sports Co-ordinators must enter on behalf of schools. Late entries can not be accepted, so don’t miss out! Check out the Zespri AIMS Games website for more details www.nzaimsgames.co.nz AIMS Games Entries close on Wed 5 June first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.summary: Landing in a new country, you learn to adapt very fast.
